### canSimplifyCallFramePseudos() {#a68ed065274d6f54ebcd2946711871363}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::HexagonFrameLowering::canSimplifyCallFramePseudos (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
canSimplifyCallFramePseudos - When possible, it&#39;s best to simplify the call frame pseudo ops before doing frame index elimination.

This is possible only when frame index references between the pseudos won&#39;t need adjusting for the call frame adjustments. Normally, that&#39;s true if the function has a reserved call frame or a frame pointer. Some targets (Thumb2, for example) may have more complicated criteria, however, and can override this behavior.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagonframelowering-h/#l00072">72</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagonframelowering-h">HexagonFrameLowering.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### determineCalleeSaves() {#a878a2b864e18e3d074d75b426ea7912d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void HexagonFrameLowering::determineCalleeSaves (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitvector">BitVector</a> &amp; SavedRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regscavenger">RegScavenger</a> &#42; RS) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method determines which of the registers reported by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo/#ad71b5bc0aa81f5dec06cbfecaf2f7183">TargetRegisterInfo::getCalleeSavedRegs()</a> should actually get saved.

The default implementation checks populates the <code>SavedRegs</code> bitset with all registers which are modified in the function, targets may override this function to save additional registers. This method also sets up the register scavenger ensuring there is a free register or a frameindex available. This method should not be called by any passes outside of PEI, because it may change state passed in by <code>MF</code> and <code>RS</code>. The preferred interface outside PEI is getCalleeSaves.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagonframelowering-h/#l00083">83</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagonframelowering-h">HexagonFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagonframelowering-cpp/#l02077">2077</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagonframelowering-cpp">HexagonFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### eliminateCallFramePseudoInstr() {#a5811c2c8b5e1ef63c58694190f8bd8c9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineBasicBlock::iterator HexagonFrameLowering::eliminateCallFramePseudoInstr (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> MI) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method is called during prolog/epilog code insertion to eliminate call frame setup and destroy pseudo instructions (but only if the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a> is using them).

It is responsible for eliminating these instructions, replacing them with concrete instructions. This method need only be implemented if using call frame setup/destroy pseudo instructions. Returns an iterator pointing to the instruction after the replaced one.

### getCalleeSavedSpillSlots() {#acb02b62a77b649bcc7c89b940563bbee}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SpillSlot &#42; llvm::HexagonFrameLowering::getCalleeSavedSpillSlots (unsigned &amp; NumEntries) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
getCalleeSavedSpillSlots - This method returns a pointer to an array of pairs, that contains an entry for each callee saved register that must be spilled to a particular stack location if it is spilled.

Each entry in this array contains a &lt;register,offset&gt; pair, indicating the fixed offset from the incoming stack pointer that each register should be spilled at. If a register is not listed here, the code generator is allowed to spill it anywhere it chooses.

### getFrameIndexReference() {#a75d48c8917ed2a09d85cf46fcda67002}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>StackOffset HexagonFrameLowering::getFrameIndexReference (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, int FI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &amp; FrameReg) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
getFrameIndexReference - This method should return the base register and offset used to reference a frame index location.

Returns the displacement from the frame register to the stack frame of the specified index, along with the frame register used (in output arg FrameReg).

The offset is returned directly, and the base register is returned via FrameReg.

This is the default implementation which is overridden for some targets.

### orderFrameObjects() {#a897d513f6255e5eeaba5074ca4095230}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void HexagonFrameLowering::orderFrameObjects (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; int &gt; &amp; objectsToAllocate) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Order the symbols in the local stack frame.

The list of objects that we want to order is in <code>objectsToAllocate</code> as indices into the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo">MachineFrameInfo</a>. The array can be reordered in any way upon return. The contents of the array, however, may not be modified (i.e. only their order may be changed). By default, just maintain the original order.

  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
restoreCalleeSavedRegisters - Issues instruction(s) to restore all callee saved registers and returns true if it isn&#39;t possible / profitable to do so by issuing a series of load instructions via loadRegToStackSlot().

### findShrunkPrologEpilog() {#a311eebe9ac3a0801e323a038b157a4a4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void HexagonFrameLowering::findShrunkPrologEpilog (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42;&amp; PrologB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42;&amp; EpilogB) const</>}>
Implements shrink-wrapping of the stack frame.

By default, stack frame is created in the function entry block, and is cleaned up in every block that returns. This function finds alternate blocks: one for the frame setup (prolog) and one for the cleanup (epilog).

### shouldInlineCSR() {#a1c65e3345014328fbc6953223831ceb2}

<MemberDefinition

Determine whether the callee-saved register saves and restores should be generated via inline code.

If this function returns &quot;true&quot;, inline code will be generated. If this function returns &quot;false&quot;, additional checks are performed, which may still lead to the inline code.
